org.gearman

Interface GearmanFunction


  • public interface GearmanFunction
    A GearmanFunction provides the interface to create functions that can be executed by the GearmanWorker.
    Author:
    isaiah

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] work(java.lang.String function, byte[] data, GearmanFunctionCallback callback)
      The working method of a gearman function.

    • Method Detail

      • work

        byte[] work(java.lang.String function,
          byte[] data,
          GearmanFunctionCallback callback)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The working method of a gearman function. A GearmanFunction is registered with a GearmanWorker to let it know when a job for this function comes in, to execute this method.

        If a runtime exception is thrown while executing the function. The job fails. A fail event is sent back to the client and the exception message is logged on the local machine (worker size).

        If a null value is returned, it is assumed the execution was successful but no data is to be sent back to the client.

        Once this method has returned, the job is complete. Calling any method from the given GearmanFunctionCallback will result in an IllegalStateException
        Parameters:
        function - gearman function name
        data - gearman job data
        callback - An object used to send intermediate data back to the client while the job is executing
        Returns:
        The result data of the job's execution
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the job's execution fails
